p: Overall health system strengthening would also help reduce transmission through improvements in blood screening and safety, injection safety and infection control to reduce blood-borne virus transmission ( 37). Cost models have also established the cost-effectiveness of hepatitis B maternal-to-child prevention strategies when integrated with existing HIV and sexually-transmitted-infection screening programmes ( 42), fast-tracking achievement of SDG goals through resource sharing and resulting in cross-sectoral benefits for neonatal and maternal morbidity and mortality and hepatitis B elimination(42).
